cs1302.game

Class MinesweeperGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs1302.game.MinesweeperGame

  • public class MinesweeperGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a game of Minesweeper Alpha.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MinesweeperGame(java.lang.String seed)
      Constructs a MinesweeperGame object with configurations from a seed file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isLost()
      Returns boolean value based on if the player has revealed a mine, which decides if the game is lost or not.
      boolean isWon()
      Returns boolean value based on if the player has met the following conditions, which represent whether the game is won or not: (1) All squares containing a mine are marked as definitely containing a mine; and (2) All squares not containing a mine are revealed.
      void play()
      Provides and runs the main game loop by invoking the printWelcome(), printMineField(), isWon(), and promptUser() methods.
      void printLoss()
      Prints the loss message to standard output.
      void printMineField()
      Prints the current contents of the mine field/grid to standard output.
      void printWelcome()
      Prints a welcome message banner to standard output.
      void printWin()
      Prints the win message to standard output, which includes the player's final score.
      void promptUser()
      Prints the game prompt to standard output and interprets user input/commands, such as reveal, mark, guess, nofog, guess, help, and quit.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinesweeperGame

        public MinesweeperGame(java.lang.String seed)
        Constructs a MinesweeperGame object with configurations from a seed file.
        Parameters:
        seed - String representation of the path to the seed file

    • Method Detail

      • printWelcome

        public void printWelcome()
        Prints a welcome message banner to standard output.

      • printMineField

        public void printMineField()
        Prints the current contents of the mine field/grid to standard output. Employs the private helper methods getPad(int) and getSquare(int,int). Includes implementation for the nofog command.

      • promptUser

        public void promptUser()
        Prints the game prompt to standard output and interprets user input/commands, such as reveal, mark, guess, nofog, guess, help, and quit. Employs the methods commandCheck(), getNumAdjMines(int,int), isWon(), printWin(), printWin(), isLost(), and printLoss(). Increments the rounds instance variable with every valid command.

      • isWon

        public boolean isWon()
        Returns boolean value based on if the player has met the following conditions, which represent whether the game is won or not: (1) All squares containing a mine are marked as definitely containing a mine; and (2) All squares not containing a mine are revealed. Employed by the promptUser() and play() methods.
        Returns:
        true if all conditions are met; false otherwise

      • isLost

        public boolean isLost()
        Returns boolean value based on if the player has revealed a mine, which decides if the game is lost or not. Employed by the promptUser() method.
        Returns:
        true if a mine has been revealed; false otherwise

      • printWin

        public void printWin()
        Prints the win message to standard output, which includes the player's final score. Called by the promptUser() method when the conditions for winning are met.

      • printLoss

        public void printLoss()
        Prints the loss message to standard output. Called by the promptUser() method when the player uncovers a mine.

      • play

        public void play()
        Provides and runs the main game loop by invoking the printWelcome(), printMineField(), isWon(), and promptUser() methods.
